Reviews.Title: “Excellent urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dangank
Reviews.Content: This Uptown luxury hotel is a real 4.75/5 stars. The complimentary Bentley service, wonderful front desk staff, and modern rooms round out the goodness. On the minus side: an alarm waking me at 5:45 on a saturday morning (prior guest's work), hallways full of dirty laundry and dishes, and smallish and non-HDTV TVs. Still, these few blemishes are well off-set by the lovely lobby, good gym, Fearing's restaurant, and great room service. Probably the best in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: danwallace
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great food, great rooms, great gym and a great location - every amenity a business traveller would need plus the things you didn't think of.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service and delicious good”
Reviews.Author: ChiKYtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business and it is certainly at the high end of Ritz Carltons based on where this hotel company has gone with tired properties over the past few years. This was one of the best I have stayed in with gorgeous rooms and great workout facilities as well. Additionally I had both breakfast and dinner in the restaurant and they were fantastic, very pricey but delicious food with great service.

Reviews.Title: “What can you say, it's a Ritz. Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: krp87b
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect. The employees were super nice. The room was comfortable and clean. The lobby area along with the free margarita and guacamole night was a lot of fun. And to top it off, they would give you a free ride to any of the restaurants in downtown Dallas. And it was in a 2012 Bentley. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DionneJDavis
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton, Dallas is a wonderful property. Great public areas and staff. First class service. They even chauffeur you around in a Bentley! I felt so well-attended to and appreciated. They had complimentary margarita shooters and chips 'n guacamole in the early evening. I had a drink at the bar at Fearing's. Next time, I'll have dinner as well. Oh, one more thing, Huge bathrooms with separate tub and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Pkelly007
Reviews.Content: Truly a Ritz Carlton experience. Very attentive staff and property is located near several restaurants/shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the finest hotels EVER!”
Reviews.Author: SpagirlHouston
Reviews.Content: I just can not say enough positive things about this hotel. Your stay will be worth every single penny. The service is impeccable (this is my favorite thing about the hotel), the rooms incredibly clean and comfortable and the location is PERFECT! We come to Dallas at least twice a year and I sometimes hesitate on if I want to spend that much money on a hotel but I have now decided this is my go-to hotel for Dallas. It really doesn't get any better than this. The only hotel experience that I have had that rivals this hotel was the Ritz Carlton in Grand Cayman - and they are a resort!! But the quality service is the exact same. I absolutely love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “They wrote the book on Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Paperman87
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at multiple Ritz Carlton properties during the last 20+ years and we are used to their standards of excellence. This property is no exception. We were in Dallas on a combination of business and pleasure and arrived on a Sunday. We checked in, and told the valet that we wanted to visit the sculpture garden and any other museums nearby. The staff was quick to help us orient, and since it was a picture perfect day, we declined their offer of a lift (in the hotel Bentley), and walked a few blocks following their directions. When we returned, the valets greeted us like old friends and made suggestions for dining that night. We were told not to miss the homemade guacamole serving at 6, and after a perfect cocktail at the amazingly comfortable lounge, the Bently whisked us a few blocks to a great Asian restaurant. During our entire stay, we were treated like guests in a gracious southern home. Excellence is something so rare, that when it occures, you simply don't notice it at first. You just find it perfect to be in this particular space and time, and then you are delighted when it continues.

Reviews.Title: “Does it get any better than this !”
Reviews.Author: CharlieTuna1951
Reviews.Content: It does not get any better than this. Great hotel with great service. I always feel like a princess when I stay at this hotel. Ritz Carlton must emphasize the importance of great customer service to their employees because everyone was so helpful and genuinely nice. Not a negative vibe all weekend. The only negative, towels were not fluffy.....

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: jointfixer
Reviews.Content: Truly the nicest Ritz I have stayed at the. The staff was amazing. I am still dreaming about the delicious food at Fearing's Restaurant. The spa experience was luxurious and wonderful. House car is a Bentley and mad it very convenient traveling to the convention center and back. I can not say enough about this hotel. Can't wait to go again. They have it all including a happening lobby lounge. Who knew.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect: Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SpiderBoy
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Dallas is a great hotel. Dallas is similar to LA and you will need a car to get around the highways. We stayed on the club level, which is great with access to a fantastic ever-changing range of things to eat. Positives: pool, fitness centre, restaurant, staff, bed. Negatives: near nothing = you will need a car. Tips: Visit Sixth floor museum, NorthPark Shopping Centre, Fort Worth Stockyards (maze was a hit with the kids, long-horn cattle drive and have lunch at H3 Ranch).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and equally great staff”
Reviews.Author: drew3114
Reviews.Content: I was recently on a business trip in Dallas and stayed at the Ritz Carlton Dallas for the 3rd time and it has been an increasingly great experience with each visit. The hotel lives up to the Ritz standard of impeccable quality in everything they do from the Fearing Restaurant to the great spa. While working out in the well equipped gym I tweaked my back and decided to use the spa to help alleviate some pain. Everyone from the concierge to spa staff were incredibly helpful and courteous. The rooms are very spacious and very clean. The bathrooms are also well appointed. Overall it is a great place to stay if you are traveling to Dallas for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spa experience I have ever had!!!”
Reviews.Author: robert f
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is magnificent.. Beautiful lobby, rooms and probably the best service I have ever experienced!! My husband and I love going to the spa whenever we travel and I am pretty sure we will come back to Dallas just to visit the spa again!! I had a massage and facial with Tarrah, as well as, a mani/pedi with Bryant.. Both were amazing!! My husband came in the next day and requested Tarrah for his massage and loved it! The locker room attendant was great too!! She fulfilled my every need!

Reviews.Title: “A Lot of Comfort in the Big D”
Reviews.Author: AGoodCupofJoe
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend in Dallas at the Ritz. It sure lived up to the Ritz reputation, and as an aside, not all Ritzs do. From the doorman thru the front desk to all of the other employees, they make you feel welcome and at home. The restaurant, Fearing's was fantastic. If you can afford the club level you will be treated to marvelous food and treats all day and a great variety of spirits as well. A special shout out to Larry in the club â€“ service excellence at itâ€™s very best

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected....AND MORE!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler0411
Reviews.Content: Being in the travel industry, I have experienced it all. Going to Ritz Carlton, you have a certain expectation of things. And this hotel, supersedes all of them. After a full day of work and then an evening flight, you just want to get to your hotel room. My only problem, after checking in, my girlfriend and I were brought to a gorgeous 1 bedroom suite which stunk of smoke. Unfortunately, I was told that all the suites with balconies are taken by smokers. After waiting for a quick 10 minutes, a very nice woman came upstairs and moved us to another one bedroom suite. This one was much larger, due to the lack of no balcony. My only wish for the room, windows that open. The room was very large and open with a large bathroom and very comfy bed. The room also had a guest closet and guest bathroom. The one drawback for the two closets, only 10 hangars all together. Otherwise, the room amenities were wonderful. The shower was nice and large, wonderful bath, and I LOVED the bed. I had club access with my room, but never used it. We ate breakfast daily in Fearings, which was perfect.The food was always cooked perfectly, and the one day that I used the buffet, let's just say, I was impressed. We never had dinner at Fearings though. One would think, being a hotel guest you'd be given preference, but that's a big NO. The hotel's location was perfect. It was in the nicest part of Dallas, and walking distance to EVERYTHING. But for those times that you don't want to walk, the hotel has a flying spur which took us everywhere within 3 miles of the property. The concierges Adon and Robert, were both worthy of being noted. Those two guys went out of their ways to make sure we were happy and treated us not just like hotel guests, but as friends. Another thing to be noted, Adon recommended a great shop (within 3 miles and you do need a car) called Pink's western wear. Their prices are cheap, their service is above par, and you're part of the family when you're there. I must say, I highly recommend this hotel. It's perfect for anyone just visiting the city or coming on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--as expected”
Reviews.Author: Dallas37
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night, while in the city to celebrate my birthday. I had a king size, corner room. As you would expect of a Ritz, it was very nice. decor was a little dated...but not bad by any means. Being in Dallas, I expected more of a High End Texas theme...but it was a standard, high end hotel theme. Valet was quick, but overnight was $25....very steep for the area (Dallas does not have New York pricing!). I was greeted quickly and they acknowledged my Birthday, offering suggestions for the night, if I needed. The room was very clean and the bathroom was among the best hotel bathrooms I have been in...excellent job! I requested a high floor...got the 4th floor. It wasn't a bad view, but I wanted a bit higher...not a huge loss though. The only critique i have of the room is the TV size. It was roughly a 32" (if it was larger, I would be surprised). Because of the distance from the chair and desk, I think they could have splurged for 46". Just a preference on my part...certainly not a deal breaker. The linens and furniture were excellent. 2 bathrobes were supplied. Service during my stay was great. The bar in the lobby made great drinks and staff was friendly. They have a guacamole and margarita tasting in the lobby in the evenings....this was great! They were the Chef Dean's Signature Margarita, and it was only a shot glass size, but it was a great margarita! I had room service later that night...as is typical, pricing was on the high end. But the food was perfect and service was quick and very friendly! I would not hesitate to stay here again! One warning...weekends in the bar are quite busy! Late night takes on a high end "night club" feel, with the crowd spilling over into the hotel lobby. Valet took a very long time, with traffic backed up into the street. This was not a huge issue for me and did not distract from my stay...but I can see it bothering some.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Great Service”
Reviews.Author: keyeyw
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Ritz is wonderful. This location has a great staff and wonderful service. Rooms are some of the better rooms in the chain.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Treatment in Big D”
Reviews.Author: JBHAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ritz Carlton Dallas several times and have compared it to other properties like The Crescent Hotel and The Mansion on Turtle Creek. There really is no comparison when you take into consideration the location, the personal hands-on treatment given, the restaurants on property and nearby and the shopping nearby. The staff remembers your name, makes sure your personal preferences are addressed and helped us through a few very trying circumstances that arose with our travel during out stay. Make sure to eat at Fearings, it is the best restaurant in Dallas. Consistently 5 star food! Dean Fearing is always on property and in the dining room watching over things. The spa is amazing, the best in Dallas and the workout facility is HUGE and has every machine imaginable! For our family, the Ritz Carlton is the only hotel we will visit when traveling through Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay on our Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: We used my Marriott points to book a room for our anniversary around Christmas. When we arrived we were greeted by name and told Happy Anniversary and informed we had been upgraded to a suite. About 15 mins after we got to our room, room service delivered a complimentary champagne and strawberry treat compliments of Guest Relations Coordinator Bryan. We had a great time, the suite was great...my only complaint was that the bed was not very comfortable. Have stayed in many Marriott branded hotels all over, one of the big reasons is for the great beds, however this one at the Ritz was lumpy and not that great. Overall great experience and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler0696
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice on New Year's Eve and were very pleased both times. The hotel still feels new and is always very clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. This year they upgraded us to a junior suite and we even had a view of the fireworks at Victory Park. Fearing's is wonderful for brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice (after all, it's the Ritz), but...”
Reviews.Author: Boomerandlibby
Reviews.Content: But they took over an hour to seat us for dinner, even though we had a reservation. I think they get too busy for Christmas, but the hotel part of it all was typical Ritz

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GoSTLCards6161
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous property. Staff is awesome. Dinner in Fearings was amazing. Rooms are huge! Only drawback was the 8 minute walk to Starbucks in the freezing cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PRS23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending a night at this hotel last week. What a beautiful place! Check-in was well organized and we loved not waiting. The room was extremely clean and wonderful. Every employee at this hotel seemed to go out of their way to make us feel welcome. I highly recommend this facility to anyone staying in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GabyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I travel for work and this remains one of my favorite hotel. The rooms are beautiful and staff goes out of it's way to make it a perfect stay"

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: defresh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group from my work. My company treated us to a night with dinner and breakfast package at Fearing's. What a night! The service at the Ritz is top notch. I'm not sure how it could have been any better. It starts with the valet and front desk staff treating you like a king. The room was not the biggest or modern I've stayed in but very roomy and unbelievably clean. Everything in it seemed very classy and the bed was extremely comfortable. Very nice bathroom. The dinner at Fearings was good. I have to say the breakfast buffet on Saturday was the best buffet I've had. I've never been asked by last name in a buffet line if I'd like more apple juice. Pretty impressive. I hope to stay there again and wish the best to the Ritz staff for making it a night to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: RNG1008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a weekly basis during this summer for business purposes. I've tried a few of the other alleged 4-5 star hotels and those that are rated higher here on TripAdvisor and I cannot understand why Ritz-Carlton is ranked so low. The other hotels, quite frankly, are not comparable. The Four Seasons in Irving is the only other comp but the location is completely different. The drawback I've found at this particular Ritz is the front desk hotel staff. Arguably the worst front desk hotel staff at any Ritz-Carlton globally I've stayed at (I stay between 30 - 50 nights at Ritz-Carlton globally per year). However, since I try to minimize the amount of time I'm at the front desk, it's not a real issue for me here. The rooms are nice and just what you would expect for a city Ritz-Carlton in the U.S. Location is quite good with many good restaurants within walking distance (although it's insanely hot to walk around in Dallas during the summer). The gym and pool are also quite nice and very good for a hotel. Service in other areas of the hotel, including the spa and fitness center, was very good. The in-hotel restaurant is also excellent, definitely worth a try. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: Local-Beer
Reviews.Content: The greeting starts with a valet staff second to none, they remember not only your name but your car, the door is opened and check in is flawless, the Concierge is on top of any thing you need. Stay on the Concierge Level for delightful goodies and great service. Now it is time to decide on dinner and drinks. First stop is the back in the Lobby at 6p for mini margarita and the best Guacamole you have ever had and it is complimentary. Next stop is the Rattle Snake Bar and meet the best bartenders ever Jaime has a fabulous Martini, Jillian has the Blood Orange/Cinnamon Mezcalita, Cedric and Ryan make the crew one of the best I have ever seen. Remember as an appetizer the Lobster nachos but ask for all salsa on the side. You will also find this crew taking care of you at the patio bar where they might the game on. Final stop is dinner in Fearing's for a Dean Fearing experience, great food. Try the buffalo among other things. Be sure to ask Paul what wine to have with you choices and you will be pleased. All in all it is an experience that I will continue to enjoy both as a traveler and a local. A great Oasis in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel staff and spa”
Reviews.Author: Foodwise
Reviews.Content: The Dallas Ritz is one of the best in the country. Although the location is not ideal, the serenity of the hotel in the middle of downtown dallas can not be beat! The outdoor pool was inviting, but too hot outside for me to really enjoy. The fitness room is large, with cold towels, water with cucumbers etc. The spa services are EXCELLENT! One of the main reasons to go. The whirlpool in the ladies area was relaxing and inviting, the relaxation area was quiet and serene, and the nail salon area was located far enough away from the main spa area so that it did not distract from the overall relaxing experience. The nail technician there and spa staff in general were really top notch, attentive, and very kind. I'd return to the Ritz, just for the spa! The restaurant on site was also very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with seamless service”
Reviews.Author: FarAwayTraveler
Reviews.Content: In April I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Dallas for a few nights. My stay was comfortable; I enjoyed both the room and the staff. Checking in was quick. The room was of average size for an nice hotel. Everything was spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets had a high enough thread count that you could almost slide off the bed. It is hard to remember anything negative. Perhaps the hotel AV staff could tune the televisions to turn on with the volume at a lower setting. Wifi costs extra (no surprise). The good news is that the connection was fast. The bathroom was large and had plenty of counterspace on the dual sinks. I had plenty of water pressure. The soaps and shampoo were nice but nothing especially memorable. All in all, my stay at the Ritz was great and I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, Friendly Staff, But Otherwise Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: Not sure what it is about Ritz Carlton's- they seek to compete in the same market segment as Four Seasons and Park Hyatts, but, on avergae, they're never quite to the standards of those hotels. The Dallas Ritz Carlton is Exhibit A. Impressive lobby when you walk in-beautiful flower arrangements steal the show, with what it is (allegedly) one of Dallas' trendiest bars to the left. The staff is exceeding friendly, but in that superficial obsequious tradition typical of middle America that becomes grating within 2 minutes. The room, however, left something to be desired. The design was the aspiring mcmansion look from that old TV show Designing Women that American suburbanites aspire to. The Wallpaper was something from another era. The toilet flush has to be held down for some time in order for the toilet to actually flush. The handset of cordless phone on the desk didn't work when the phone rang, and by the time I fiddled with it and then rushed to the bedside phone, the call was missed. The wireless internet was maddeningly weak (come on people- this is the 21st century!). At night there were noises of unknown mechanical origin rattling in the background from time-to-time. On the plus side, in the morning they delivered a Financial Times without me requesting it upon check-in - high marks, at least, for an actually readable newspaper. Memo to management: you have work to do.

Reviews.Title: “Would be a nice Marriott, but not up to the name Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: DogLawyer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May when we were in Dallas to see a baseball game for his birthday. We have stayed at many other Ritz Carlton locations over the year so we had some expectations. Nothing about our stay met those expectations. Th room was shabby. Chipped furniture, worn bedding and our ro om was missing the safe. Literally missing. The hotel sent someone up to look for it. Bizarre. Our room wasn't ready when we checked in, when we came back hours later after visiting a museum or after we sat and waited for over half an hour after being told it just needed to be checked. I finally told the woman at the front desk that we would go enjoy a cocktail in the bar compliments of the hotel and she could come get us when the room was ready. A true Ritz would have had our room ready or made that suggestion on their own. The most shocking part of our stay was the lhe lobby and bar the night we returned from the game. The bar at Fearings had great cocktails and a fabulous bartender we had met the night before, so after the game we decided to stop by for a drink. There was a loud band playing and the place was packed. It had been transformed into a very cheesy nightclub. And there were lots of women there who appeared to be "ladies of the night" if you know what I mean. And I don't mean high priced escorts. Trashy looking, working girls. And this must be the norm since there were no less than half a dozen uniformed policemen roaming through the bar all night and a line of security blocking entrance to the hotel elevators. And there was a bathroom "monitor" who my husband pointed out seemed to be making sure only one person at a time went into the bathroom. Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: dad2sam
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel...it was simply amazing !!!!! We went there for my suprise 40th birthday, in October 2010 to see the Dallas Cowboys play the NY Giants and the Ritz was the special part of my gift. We stayed on the conceirge level, where they included light food all day, plus all the drinks you want (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic). The bar downstairs in the main lobby was very nice, by why pay for drinks when you get them for free if you stay on the conceriege level. It was an incredible experince overall. The room was tremendous, spacious and absolutely spotless. There was a walk in closet, the bathroom had a TV in t he mirror and there was so much room in the bathroom area, you could've fit 10 people in there and never bump into one another. The staff was super friendly and we kept on asking for places to eat and every place they recommended was top shelf. They all knew what the customer wanted and they provided. The pool was clean and t he gym was great. I can't wait to go back to Dallas for a return trip and I WILL BE STAYING at the RITZ again !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Diamond8000
Reviews.Content: The Ritz was a beautiful and welcoming hotel to stay in the center of Dallas. There were lots of great restuarants in the area as well as the in house restuarant in the Ritz. There were a group of us and we all found this hotel delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: TXCtrow
Reviews.Content: It was an Oasis of bliss as soon as I walked into the lobby. DiDi, the happiest guy in Dallas, held the door for me and I walked in and was drawn immediately to the beautiful floral centerpieces. DiDi named each flower for me! Check-in was a breeze. It was the beginning to just what I needed, peace and relaxation. I was in town for business at a different hotel but a previous visit to the Ritz-Carlton Dallas had me coming back for more. The room was spacious and sparkling clean. We had a beautiful view of the Crescent. I was in pillow heaven, could not wait to be wrapped up in luxurious bedding. Had the best night sleep ever. Enjoyed room service for breakfast which was top notch, both service and the food. I was off to work but dreaming about coming back to the Ritz-Carlton to visit the spa. All I could think about the prior month was utter relaxation and the spa did not disappoint! All my stress melted away and the massage was way more than I hoped it would be. My shoulder was extremely tight and Joseph took the time and caring to make sure I was feeling absolutely wonderful before I left. He was extremely knowledgeable and skilled. For me this stay was perfect. I did bring my spouse and eight year old son along on this trip. My child was a little bored. He had his heart set on swimming in the pool but it was very crowded with a "drinking" crowd. Reminded me of the party pools in Las Vegas. So he was very disappointed. I was sad because he loves to swim. But the hotel is within walking distance of many things to keep him entertained.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Good Sized Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CAKarenOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August while looking at colleges. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was large enough for me and my 2 teenage sons - as the couch opened into a bed for one boy and the room could hold a roll away bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for stays in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: winchpete
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Club level room. It felt a bit too large to be cosy almost as if it needed more furniture. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom well equipped. There were some stains and marks on the carpets and walls in the bedroom. The Club lounge provided a comfortable and quiet environment. It offered a good continental breakfast and wide choice of snacks and drinks throughout the day. If you feel like something more substantial, the main retaurant is also good but as I stayed in 'Restaurant Week' it was crowded and service felt rushed. The concierge was very helpful and suggested I make use of the house car - a Bentley - that will take guests up to 3 miles from the hotel. Unfortunately it was too hot (over 100 degrees) to take advantage of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Xanadu”
Reviews.Author: Gutreaction
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Dallas is perfect. the property is new and extraordinary. the rooms are spacious. the baths are marvelous and some have TV's hidden in the mirrors. They get it and they designed the hotel for comfort for high end business travelers. The fitness center is large and has windows. There are a number of new Precor treadmills and elipticals, each with it's own TV. They also have a nice circuit of top quality weight machines. The pool is lovely and private on an upper floor off the fitness center. The spa completes this floor with a full blown salon, a dozen treatment rooms,and locker rooms that are the envy of every other high end hotel. The food is remarkable. The hotel is home to Dean Fearing's restaurant where they prepare innovative Southwestern cuisine. the lobster nachos are a must. Dean is on site and is likely to visit your table and chat. his passion is what makes his restaurant a breed apart. His staff is exceptional. They great you by name, they remember what you like to eat and drnk, and they genuinely care about your comfort. As one example, the staff knows what I like for breakfast and that I like to sit at the bar. They find out when I am in house and the set up is waitin for me each morning along with the NY Times at my usual seat at the bar courtesy of Linda who is amazing. The bar staff is at the very top of the game. The bartenders-- Jamie, Jillian, Sedrick, Ryan and Amir are pros. They will remember your drink and your name and greet you like an old friend. Johnnie doubles as a bartender and cocktail waitress and she is wonderful and Rachel, another cocktail waitress is one of the best in the business. Mary and Samantha are the guardians of the gate at Fearing's and they will try to accommodate any request. The folks in the spa are wonderful too. Stephanie cuts hair as good as anyone in Beverly Hills and sings in a band on the weekends.Sheena does nails and she treats you like family. Aryn gives a great deep tissue massage and she is a sweetheart. Julie rinse the spa and she will attempt to accommodate just about any reasonable request, even finding me an extra large bathrobe! Kent is the conceirge. He can accomplish just about anything on short notice and with a smile.He can also get the house car--a Bentley-- to take you up to 3 miles away. Nice touch rolling up on your friends in a Bentley. The front door staff is great. DiDi and Melvin great you like an old friend and Steven does a great job and he enjoys his work and it ahows. I know I am leaving out some great people, but they are all excellent. Andrea at the front desk always greets me with a smile and they often upgrade their best customers without you having to ask. There is a wonderful club. room with great food, so ask them about the club floor when you check into the hotel. I have stayed at most of the t hotels in the country and all of the Ritz Carlton hotels in America and the Ritz Carlton Dallas is the very best because the people are passionate about providing outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for a Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: stlanne
Reviews.Content: I surprised my 20 year old daughter by staying here for a weekend. This hotel did not meet my expectations on several levels. The bed was very uncomfortable with small pillows, bedding nothing special. The next day I had a bad back ache and decided to use the sparkling bath tub for a bubble bath - there was no stopper so i could not take a bath. The walls are thin so you can hear conversatoins in the next room. The door vibrated from the HVAC duct work in the hall - annoying. The pool is average. There are not enough umbrellas for such a hot climate. The chairs are nice and there is a service to order food/drinks. The gym is top notch. The staff is attentive and very courteous - the best part of the stay. We did enjoy a ride in the house car - a Bentley which can take you anywhere in a 3 mile radius. We enjoyed complimentary mini margaritas in the lobby with the guacamologist! This hotel just seems a bit tired and not a lot of attention to details. My bill was slightly wrong - they corrected it with no questions. If you want a luxury hotel in Dallas I would looking at other options as well in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level offers great comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Tsimtcu8
Reviews.Content: Firt time to stay at this Ritz, great location. Spa was great, room on the club level can't be beat with endless food and drinks, the pool area was very nice and relaxing. Overall my favorite hotel in dallas so far.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay at a hotel 4 blocks from home?”
Reviews.Author: Art_lover_Dallas
Reviews.Content: About every 6 months, we make a weekend reservation at the Ritz-Carlton in Dallas, which is just a few blocks from where we live. Why? It is a self-contained oasis of tranquility and luxury. When we are ready to get away but too stressed or tired to deal with airports, this is the perfect solution. It's amusing when we arrive because every staff member asks: "How was your trip?" But from the time we walk through the front entrance of the lobby, it is as if we have entered another world. Be sure to book spa treatments when you book your room because they are hard to get. The spa is one of the best: there are fantastic water areas (steam, sauna, showers) and a relaxation room for napping, reading, or a light meal during time before/between/after your treatments. The facials and massages are wonderful and top rate. If you want a manicure and pedicure, I really cannot recommend their services. Same with the hair treatments/salon. Both have been consistent disappointments. But don't let this deter you from the body and facial treatments in the spa. The workout room is immaculately clean with state of the art fitness equipment. It opens to the pool, where there is great service for drinks, towels, food, etc. We typically reserve a suite and have dinner in our room since we dine at the restaurant frequently anyway. Room service is excellent. One of our main criteria is room service: from the variety of offerings to the ease of ordering to the actual service, and of course, the food itself. For breakfast, their coffee is HOT and very strong - just the way I perfer. The beds are comfortable, linens are luxurious. Next time, I'm going to inquire about softer pillows. Bathrooms are typical Ritz-Carlton luxury. If you are at all unsteady, request a slip proof mat for the shower - the stone floors can be very slipery. Amenities are lovely. I always purchase a large container of their shaving creme (the absolute BEST) and their body lotion in the gift shop as we check out. When we had a guest from out of town, rather than putting her in our guest room, I treated her to a room at this Ritz-Carlton so she could indulge herself in the spa and avoid our exceptionally friendly dogs. She loved it and was most appreciative of the gift. We prefer the Dallas Ritz-Carlton over all the choices of luxury hotels here because it is a total immersion in the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Double check that you have your luggage when you leave”
Reviews.Author: oklahomasooner00
Reviews.Content: We travel and stay in hotels in Dallas about every other month. Each time we try an new hotel. We have stayed at Rose Crescent, Adolphus, ZaZa, Westin, Intercontinental and are getting ready to stay at the Gaylord Texan in a few days. The Ritz has so far been the nicest one with the best service. The only problem that we encountered was when we were leaving. The bell boy took our luggage and stored it while we ate breakfast at the restaurant on site. After we were finished the valet went to get our car and the bell boy said he would put our luggage in while we checked out. We live in the Oklahoma city area. We stopped in Ardmore to get more gas and realized that our luggage was not in the trunk. I called Ritz Carlton and they said they would ship it to us. I was happy about that, but was surprised that we were not given a free night or something. Especially since my luggage had all my make-up and things that I would need for the next morning. I'm not one to be pushy so I didn't make a big fuss over this. I just thought for the reputation that Ritz Carlton has, they would want to make sure everyone was totally satisfied with their visit.

Reviews.Title: “TOP REVIEW: Great Customer Service, but a few major flaws...”
Reviews.Author: AdaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Let me be clear: The customer service at this hotel is second to none. The hotel is beautiful, great decor... but I know you are not reading my review for the good stuff... You want to know the "flaws." With that in mind... The room was very clean upon our arrival. Then, we opened the beside drawers to find not one, not two, but THREE open condom wrappers. Now we all know what goes on in hotel beds, but we don't need a reminder. The hotel promptly removed them and offered to change rooms. Second was the bed. This was the most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept in. I didn't complain, because I thought I had a UTI (which causes back pain). That's how bad it was... I honestly thought I was ill because of the bed. (I wasn't.) Otherwise, I would have discussed with the staff. What I DID discuss, though, was that the feathers on the feather top were poking me throughout the night, to the point that I had to pick them out of the bed. I did mention this and they removed some fees for us, not that that was my intention at all. I hope you can tell from my other reviews that I'm not a complainer... I would love to give this hotel the review I thought I would be giving before we went; however, I will probably not stay here again just based on the bed alone.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jvl3
Reviews.Content: Give everything here at this hotel an A. The service gets an A+! Staff went out of the way to make the stay perfect. Only here for one night but would be back again in a second. My favorite this would be the service, location, and the room!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Nitra315
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz for a few days in January 2011 for a business function. The staff were wonderful. They greeted me by name every morning and were incredibly accomodating throughout my stay. In particular, I'd checked out in the morning only to return later that afternoon when I missed my flight, and not only did they check me back in at my corporate (reduced) rate, they made every attempt to put me back in the same room which I felt was above and beyond. One of the perks of staying at this property is the complimentary house Bentley which will take you to any destination within 5-10 miles of the property - that was a nice value-add. The rooms were immaculate - the bathrooms were large and spacious with separate shower, tub, bathroom and vanity areas. Even though I was staying for business, coming back to that room made me feel like I was on a mini-vacation. I wouldn't hesitate to return. And the plus, my room rate was less than $200/night - for a Ritz, that's a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the club floor. The staff is excellent and the breakfast, lunch, dinner and dessert presentations were very nice. Larry in the club floor lounge is very accommodating. We had a suite on the 7th floor which was very nice room 730. It is about a 25 min drive with no traffic to drive to the hotel. Several nice restaurants within walking distance. Fitness center is very nice several bikes, treadmills, elliptical machines plus weights, and strength training machines. The pool is small and is located on the second floor outside the gym. The only issue with this hotel is they allow guests to smoke outside at the pool since it is a small area it was very annoying. Hotel restaurant was very good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mflickermd
Reviews.Content: Of first importance was the staff.Everyone ,from the bus boys to the housekeepers, to the clerks-EVERY STAFF MEMBER did their jobs well.It was wonderful to be taken care of. Our group consisted of me and my husband,daughter and SIL, and their 2 teenage children.All of us enjoyed our stay. We were on the Club Floor and having the lounge was good. My only complaint would be that there should be some hot items, other than oatmeal. We had brunch at Fearings, and again, they went out of their way to accommodate our grandchildren's off the menu choices.We also used their free car service to take us to various sights. Oh yes, the rooms were also comfortable and functional. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds!”
Reviews.Author: Orange1231
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The beds were absolutely wonderful, one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. This says a lot because I travel all the time. The rooms were spacious and the staff was always friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoSfgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz as part of an overnight spa escape for myself and a friend. We were treated like royalty from start to finish. I have stayed at many Ritz Carltons and this is probably my favorite one in terms of service. All of the staff members, from the valets to the bellhops to the front desk and room service staff, were genuinely friendly and went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect. We were upgraded to a beautiful corner room on the club floor, which was unexpected but certainly appreciated. The food presentations in the club lounge were decadent, and the club lounge host/concierge was wonderful. Our time in the spa was relaxing and we enjoyed our top quality treatments. We checked out the hotel's bar and patio, which was very lively on a Friday night, and we walked to a couple of other nearby hot spots as well. We ordered late night room service and the food was delivered promptly, with a smile. The next day we were given a late checkout so that we could enjoy a couple hours of sunshine at the pool, which was on the small side but still very pleasant. When we reluctantly checked out, we felt truly relaxed and pampered. Kudos to the staff at this Ritz for getting everything right! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: csolis
Reviews.Content: We loved every minute of it. The customer service/staff was wonderful. Their attention to detail was impeccable. They valet your car and then relay who you are to the front desk people so as soon as you go to check in they call you by your name. The room was very spacious. The bed was nice and comfy. Separate shower and bath. The bathrobes were so nice and plush. The spa area is great. They have a separate area for men and women. They have a whirlpool, steam room, dry room, shower with 5 heads, a relaxation room and shower rooms. The area was nice and private. Definitely a must to try. One drawback though is they do not have free wi-fi. However, if you ever want to splurge on a hotel I would definitely recommend trying this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravlinTXFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Ritz for an event we were attending in Dallas. The hotel is nice but a little ordinary. The room was nice; the bathroom was beautiful. The bathroom had a window next to the tub that had great views of the city. This Ritz property has a house car (a Bentley!) that can be used for short transfers on a first come first served basis. We used the car to our destination and the driver was very friendly and accommodating. We had breakfast at Fearing's and it was wonderful. About $75 for 2 people. Fearing's is a first class restaurant that we have dined at for dinner several times and it never disappoints. I don't feel like the tables are too close together as another reviewer discusses.

Reviews.Title: “Lodging Well Done!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJones5
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a business trip to Dallas and wanted to offer my whole-hearted endorsement of the Ritz-Carlton Dallas. Extremely convenient to Dallas' Love Field, this hotel far exceeded my expectations for the money. I was fortunate enough to be put into a lovely corner room with windows on two sides, nice furnishings, giant bathroom, and an I-Pod clock radio which allowed me to listen to jazz while I worked at the well-appointed desk. I even had forgotten my cuff-links, but a quick call to the front-desk, and a pair were provided no charge for me to use within minutes. If in Dallas for business or personal travel, the Ritz-Carlton is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a little flaw”
Reviews.Author: Zuerich
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is is not just an ordinary 5* hotel, this is a real luxury hotel. When we arrived, we were greeted very friendly by everybody, at check-in I politely asked for an upgrade (we already booked one of the more expensive rooms at the club level) and politely got a Deluxe Suite. The room was very nicely equipped, with nice colours and very stilish. The bed was extremyly comfortable and the bathroom spacious. Also the closet offered enough space for 2 large suitcases on a support. The room was also very clean and well mainained, but, the only little disappointement was that actually the bathroom floors were clean, but not sparkling clean, that menas, that there were still some shadows, spots and traces on the floor. Probably it has been cleaned with a mop, but not scrubbed with a brush, what I expect in a luxury hotel. Well, I know, that is very picky, but at this level I expect perfection. Speaking of perfection I can write about the club lounge which actually was perfect. Beginning from the setting and the nice dÃ©cor over to the nice selection of drinks. Especially the cocktails, made to your order were nice. The food was very varied and sophisticated, but served in very small portions. Breakfast had also very exclusive components, the only thing missing was some sort of hot items, the only thing was oatmeal, which is not very exciting, why do they not serve some scrambled egg with bacon? The staff at the lounge was very friendly and did everything possible to serve and entertain the guests. Fearings restaurant was ok, but there is not enough distance between the tables for a restaurant in its class and also the quality of the food, although being very good, can not keep up with the best restaurants in New York or Los Angeles (or Europe). So, if we return to Dallas, of course we will return to the Ritz and we definitely will book a room on the club level.

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresented truth and didn't care”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Marriott member. I had a wedding to attend at the Ritz. I was going to stay at the nearby Marriott, but thought I'd call the Ritz in Dallas directly to see what the group rate was. The man at the hotel in Dallas not only told me my status carried over from Marriott, but assured me I would be eligible for concierge level access and all the other perks I am used to with Marriott. I booked the room. When I arrived I was told that someone made a mistake. The manager said there was nothing he could do about it. I asked if he could at least see who made my reservations so that we could pass on the feedback. He didn't seem to want to look into it and said I must have talked to a central reservations location... I did not. I spoke to the hotel in Dallas. Then, the TV did not work and even though I reported it and had 3 kids with me, I received neither an apology nor a gesture of good will, like some breakfast. Also: the bed was broken and needed fixing, and although they said try fixed it, it seemed it wasn't very straight. Last, but not least, I was looking for a gift shop and asked an employee of the hotel if they had gift shop, and he said no. I saw the gift shop as I was leaving the next day. Overall, you can take your 5 stars and keep them. I'll choose Marriott next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service-does not disappoint for a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: frintern2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a shopping trip in Dallas, and we decided to splurge and stay at the Ritz for his 35th birthday. It was so nice! This is the most modern Ritz Carlton I have ever stayed in, but it was still very elegant. We were upgraded to a suite so we had plenty of room with a great view of the city. Great location-easy to walk to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience: where to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Ben_from_Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that this is a Ritz: I expect everything to be outstanding (especially given the rack rates) , and this hotel did not disappoint me. The incredibly late check-in (2:30 AM) that went as smoothly as had I been there in the late afternoon, the room was exquisite, the service was outstanding (picking up my shoes to be shined at 3 AM and having them back before 9 was great), and I couldn't recommend a hotel any more than this one. All of that said, I have two very minor complaints: the iron was missing the "cap" that held the water in, so you had to be careful while ironing not to get your shirts wet; and the shower gel in the bathroom doesn't lather well with just a washcloth (they should either give you a real bath sponge or go back to traditional bar soap). The location is very convenient for anything in Downtown or Uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: outidej
Reviews.Content: For starters, it's a rare case when I get to stay at a hotel of this caliber, but I do have a generally high bar. That being said, this place met all expectations. My room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The decor was both classic and modern. It could have used more power outlets strategically placed around the room. The alarm clock had an iPod dock. The TV was a large flat screen with good picture. The room had a large desk. The bathroom, done up in granite, was maybe the nicest thing about the room; It was large, had a separate room housing the toilet, had a tub and a seperate shower. The 24-hours workout room had ProCore equipment and had employees from the spa down the hallway frequent the room during the day, supplying water and wiping down the machines. Of course, being a luxury hotel, the in-room snack bar prices were as high as you would expect. The location is on the edge of downtown. There's a some high-end restaurants across the street, as well as a strip mall with a Wells Fargo bank, a Pei Wei restaurant (of P.F. Changs' fame) and a Potbelly Sandwich Shop (a divine toasted sub shop that originated in Chicago).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Ritz!!!”
Reviews.Author: wdm73
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel!! Loved everything about this hotel. Great location and the staff was amazing...everyone greeted you with a smile and was happy to go above and beyond to make your stay 1st class!! The food was fantastic, from in room dining to Fearings and everyone morning the coffee, french press, so yummy!! Can't wait for another trip to Dallas, just to return to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you'd expect of the Ritz Carlton - with great service”
Reviews.Author: sb1London
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for five nights and really enjoyed my time there. The service was excellent and the rooms spacious, with all the touches you would expect from a luxury hotel. Staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The food at Fearings (the hotel's restaurant), while expensive, was well presented and tasty; the hotel's bar turned into a real hotspot at night too. I would agree with comments on here about the hotel pool - it is pretty small for such a high end hotel. But really - a minor thing.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff gives travelers Texas hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: TXCtrow
Reviews.Content: My stay in Dallas was for business, brought the family along for a nice weekend. My only regret with the hotel was the large wedding that took over the property. And I do mean took over! No matter where you went, there was a pre-wedding party going on. At one point I had enough was in the spa, all I wanted to do was relax in the whirlpool, but the bridal party was having an elegant luncheon right there! I would have felt like an idiot turning on the jets and sitting there while they dined and drank champagne at a formal table set up. But to the hotel's credit the staff showed no signs of mental wear and tear. My little boy was cold from the a/c at breakfast, the hostess brought him a shawl. And the next morning the shawl was waiting for him to arrive! Everyone was so genuinely friendly. When it was time to check out my little boy had a meltdown and would not leave the room. He insisted on staying "just two more days" as he put it. Nemiah came up to get our luggage and he was so very helpful in helping me change my son's mood! He took him around to all the staff and introduced him, and EVERYONE did their best to cheer him up! The room was extremely clean, which is very important to me because of my dust allergy. Fearings is the only place you need to dine in Dallas! Muriel at Indulge makes the best coffee drinks! What was a stressful business trip for me ended up being quite blissful and friendly. I hated leaving too, I just didn't have a meltdown and refuse to leave the room! I do think there should be a limit to how much of the hotel a wedding can take over. I was hoping to get club level but that just wasn't in the cards. I am planning a trip to the Ritz Carlton Amelia Island in the near future and suspect that since we could not get a suite or a club level room there is a huge wedding event. I know if I were to have a Ritz Carlton wedding I would want it large, but I wouldn't want to short change other guests either. I have a feeling though that the Amelia Island stay I will be taking a back seat to the wedding also. The staff went above and beyond my expectations. Definately grace under pressure. I do look forward to another visit very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natsfan24
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel. The service was outstanding and you should not miss the free chips and guacamole (and margaritas) in the lobby in the evening. The rooms are well thought out and very relaxing. I had a chance to experience the club level and found that to be amazing. Great service and food. I was only sorry I did not get upgraded for the level. No worries though as my room was wonderful. Near a nice choice of dining and close to everything in Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Brandt106
Reviews.Content: First off, my wife and I were fortunate enough to stay in a club level room, which definitely had a huge impact on our experience. The entire hotel was extremely nice and clean and the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Our room was very nice and comfortable. The bars downstairs are very nice and offer a great social scene and great drinks. The club lounge was absolutely amazing! Snacks, hors d'oeuvres, champagne, wine, beer, tea, cheeses, etc., are available just about all day. Chris, the concierge in the lounge, was help full, polite, and offered great service and assistance in any way that we needed. We have been here twice and both times were amazing. We will definitely be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: gconley27
Reviews.Content: Service was overwhelmed at the pool, which is the smallest pool for this type of hotel. There are only 20 or so lounge chairs and they cram 60 people into this area. If you want to lounge poolside, choose another hotel. Also, there was no pool attendant and we had to ask people if the chairs were taken and remove the old towels and drinks to sit down. Service staff seemed rushed all day and night. They bar was fun, but was seemed understaffed. Dinner was great, but the MaÃ®tre dâ€™ snubbed my friend for asking about our reservation, which was 30 minutes late. They never came to get us when our reservation was ready, we had to go up them and ask.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this Ritz”
Reviews.Author: vacationlady1
Reviews.Content: This Ritz is in a good location. Trolly stop right near the hotel. Check in and my room was great. It was the first night when I awoke at 3:15a.m. in the morning to a blaring TV that went down hill from there. i called the front desk and advised them of the noise and they told they would take care of it. 30 mins later TV is still blaring, I went to the gym. When I returned the TV was still blaring, you could hear it outside of the room while waiting to unlock the door. It is now going on 5:30. I was going to go downstairs and when I got to the elevator, there was a man from the hotel and I advised him. The noise finally stopped at 6:00 a.m. I really think the person left (as I found out later that day when I reported it again that the person had checked out). They could not tell me why no one check with me and why the noise went on for hours. I could not open the safe as I got an error code from putting to much in the safe and someone had to come to my room to unlock. I told the man again of my problem and he said he would get back to me or his boss would call me. Again no one called. Is this how you treat someone at a high end resort. When I checked out the next morning (5:45 a.m.) the desk attendent did not ask me how my stay was. I asked if someone was outside who could get me a taxi and he said if there was not just come back inside. Of course there was no one outside and I got my own taxi as they were waiting away from the front door. I went back into the hotel to get my bag and left. I am very disappointed in my treatment and follow through for this hotel. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Service was extrodinary”
Reviews.Author: cooper12
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was attentive to every need. good pool and great workout facilities. The rooms were nice sized. The Ritz met all expectations. we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “It is Ritz. It has to be good.”
Reviews.Author: MONK09
Reviews.Content: Great Place. Rooms, Service, gym, Swimming Pool, Conference Rooms . Everything is good. Real Class. Also available, Spa and Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2travelingscientists
Reviews.Content: Great location and huge rooms. Well appointed furnishings, large bathrooms. Showers were a little small. My room was missing the Q-tip & cotton balls that you expect. Desk area in the room has crumbs from the previous occupants. Bed was clean, huge, and comfortable. The hotel work out facility and pool were fabulous. The hotel has one of the hottest bars & restaurants in town. Attended a conference in one of the meeting rooms. Well set up, good catering and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: SG425
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a suite for my 40th birthday in 2009. It was our first stay at a Ritz-Carlton and everything lived up to our expectations. The service was wonderful. We had breakfast in our room the next morning and it was a luxurious treat. The staff at the front desk made us feel like royalty. Based on our experience here, we booked the Ritz in Maui for our honeymoon later in 2009. We also had dinner at Fearing's and thought it was just ok, not great.

Reviews.Title: “Most horrible experience of disregard and poor management ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ritz_hotel1045
Reviews.Content: On May 1, 2010, I made a reservation for a manicure and pedicure at the Ritz Carlton in Dallas Texas for May 2, 2010. As requested, I provided a credit card to secure the appointment. I arrived at the hotel and was being processed into the appointment when told I could not pay for services by check as intended and that the hotel ONLY accepted credit cards. The manager said he would look into this policy and get back to me. I had the services.--nothing steller. On Monday May 10, the manager called and said if I want to use a check in the future to pay for service at the RITZ I could come the day and pay. Is this the RITZ or a sleezy hotel requiring cash upfront? Is the RITZ still solvent? I will no longer recommend the services or stay at the RITZ--see you at the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience - Will return!”
Reviews.Author: Slsaunders19
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many many many hotels in my life and the Ritz, by far, has topped them all. I traveled with my mother and we only stayed one night, but it was fabulous. Valet was beyond courteous to us, and the check-in people greet you by name which is always nice. My only complaint was that when we finally got up to our room, our key didn't work so we had to go back to the lobby, but that's really not that big of a deal, just a minor hassle. Our bags were waiting for us in our room when we finally got the door open. The beds are A-MAZING. I slept like a baby. The bathroom is incredible. Everything is beautifully done and very plush. The room service food is 5-star, which is so rare. They delivered it fairly quickly too, which is a huge plus in my book. The prices for the mini-bar snacks of course were outrageous, $8 M&M's? That's just silly. But overall it was a wonderful experience and I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware valet”
Reviews.Author: Drroady
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Ritz Carltons all over the world, well over 20 years. I was elated, in 2007, when the Dallas property opened. As a Dallas local, I do not have the opportunity to stay at the hotel very often, but go there often to enjoy their most excellent restaurant, Fearings. I encountered a problem last night, however with the valet parking services contracted by the hotel. In a word, the valet released my new Mercedes Benz to an unauthorized person who did not have a claim check to my car. When I left the restaurant, I presented my claim check to the valet. After considerable confusion, they informed me that they delivered my car to someone else and were not in possession of my car. I immediately summoned the Dallas police. The police were on the scene promptly and the car was located abandoned some time later. This morning, I personally met with the GM of the Ritz Carlton, Dallas, a very subdued, indifferent Mr. Daryl Roberts. He offered his apologies, stating this was "the first time this had ever happened" at their hotel. He offered no explanation, no compensation; nothing. The entire saga was taken so seemingly flippant, I vow to never return to the hotel and encourage others to heed my advise. I am in the process of taking this matter to a higher level, but felt it my responsibility to warn others of this serious, grave occurrence. Do not park here thinking your vehicle is secure; ever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice typical Ritz”
Reviews.Author: lwohara
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a nice location and the room size was good. The lobby was large and everyone that I met was helpful and friendly. The room decor was stale-- how could it look dated already when the hotel is so new? Bed was comfortable and view OK. The negatives-- the noise is a problem. It was loud from the street, from the neighbors wall and doors slamming when they were closed. ALso, the shower was incredibly slow to warm up and the trickle of water was not worth the wait. Breakfast was below average. It is hard to screw up an omelet but it was on the poor side. I was not there long enough to have another meal. Nice hotel, nice location, not sure it was worth the $. Might try it again to see if I missed something the first time

Reviews.Title: “The elegance you expect from Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: TX99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton for one night in February, 2010. We stayed in a club level suite booked through the American Express Platinum Travel Service (by the way, if you are an Amex Platinum card holder and not using this service, you are missing out. If you are an Amex card holder but not platinum and you travel frequently, consider upgrading. The yearly fee is higher but pays for itself with so many travel amenities-free breakfast, late check out, food and spa credits, etc...). We were celebrating my birthday and the hotel staff had balloons and a nice note waiting for us in the room when we arrived. Our room was large, well appointed and comfortable. The bathroom was big, with 2 sinks and a television built into the bathroom mirror. We did not eat at Fearing's, the hotel restaurant, but have heard from others that it is a great place. We ordered room service breakfast, which was delicious. The portions were large, especially the fruit plate. It was much more than we could eat. We booked massages at the spa (nice, modern facilities) and while mine was very enjoyable (not the best I've ever had but good) my wife became ill shortly after we got to the spa and had to cancel. The spa staff were nice enough to make sure she was OK and didn't charge her for canceling her massage. That's great service as far as I'm concerned and will not only prompt me to recommend their hotel, it will keep me coming back again and again. Our experience was great. No complaints, great service, nice room-it was exactly what I expected when I booked a room at the Ritz Carlton. I think expectations for a Ritz Carlton property should be high and our expectations were certainly met. We live fairly close to Dallas but spend a few nights a year there for pleasure. In the past, we've stayed at the Crescent but from now on, will stay at the Ritz Carlton every time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: melachocolat
Reviews.Content: I must say everything about my stay at this hotel was right. Starting with a nice and uncomplicated check in - my bags were brought to the room whils I was let to the bar for a complimentary margarita and some tacos with guacamole, even though I just had 24 hours of travelling behind me and looked like it. Rooms are nice and spacious. Very comfortable beds and quiet. Amenities include daily complimentary water and a tea and coffee maker. The bar staff incredibly friendly. So is breakfast staff even though there it appears a bit over the top. The quality of the breakfast buffet and food is extremely good though - the best breakfast buffet I ever experienced so far. I would definetely come back to this hotel any time!

Reviews.Title: “not as good as other ritz hotels i've stayed at,Not As Good A Value..”
Reviews.Author: mhallren
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't the same standard as the San Francisco or Singapore Ritz Carlton Hotels...I found the staff friendly..The hotel seemed a little understaffed...I could not use the wifi in the room..i had to pay for computer time on the club level..normally that's free on the club levels..I found the exercise area not as good as the other ritz hotels i've stayed at...No dressing rooms,lockers ,whirlpools or steam room .YOU COULD PAY FOR USE OF THE SPAS LOCKER ROOM FOR 25 DOLLARS......I found the concierge services lacking,especially compared with the staffs the Singapore and San Francisco...I thought the restaurant,, Fearings not as good a value as compared to the San Francisco or Singapore Ritz Hotel dining rooms.The hotel is beautiful and located well...but for the price i think Dallas has better options ...

Reviews.Title: “Good Ritz Carlton with great service”
Reviews.Author: 2Traveller2
Reviews.Content: This is a solid Ritz Carlton. I'm not sure how old it is, but it is clean, quiet and bright. What sets this hotel apart from most others, though, is its service. We ordered room service a couple of times and ate in the restaurant once during a one night stay -- the service was top tier. Service from the front desk staff was average for a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: KassyS
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Dallas for the White Rock Marathon. We had three young boys (ages 7, 5, and 6 months) with us. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. The room was perfect in size and quality. We loved how easy it was for us to walk everywhere we needed to go even with a stroller. We also liked how it was close enough to the nightlife to be convenient and easy (by car) but far enough away that it wasn't noisy. We will definitely be back... but without the kids next time! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Rowing784
Reviews.Content: I stay here often when I travel to Dallas for business, and this place never disappoints. The staff is extremely helpful and the kitchen was willing to make me something that wasn't even on the menu at 11pm when I arrived from the airport. The staff at the Ritz will make sure your stay is perfect and I will continue to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “First, But Not Last, Visit”
Reviews.Author: CAROLINAPANTHERFAN
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Ritz Carlton Dallas and we cannot wait until we can return. We were amazed at the personalized attention during our stay and no matter where we went in the hotel, we were greeted by name. Although we did not eat in the restaurant during dinner hours, our breakfast and lunch were fabulous. Our corner room was very spacious with a wonderful bath and view of Dallas at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Business Trip to Dallas”
Reviews.Author: MemphisBarrister
Reviews.Content: This property lives up to the Ritz-Carlton name! The staff was very professional and highly attentive. No downside to this property. It is new. The rooms are well appointed. It is slightly removed from the hustle of the downtown core, but very convenient to the Federal Courthouse and all of the downtown office towers. It is within walking distance of a galaxy of eating and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Have a Relaxing Weekend”
Reviews.Author: TXCPA64
Reviews.Content: I live in the Dallas area and enjoy an occasional weekend at one of the local hotels just to relax. This was my first time to stay at the Ritz-Carlton. I will definitely be back for another stay. From the moment I got out of my car, every one on staff welcomed me by name as I walked to the front desk. I booked this room at the last minute for one of their discounted weekend packages. While my views weren't great (construction out one window, rooftop and pool out the other), the room itself was very nice and spacious. Next time I will request a higher floor. I spent part of an afternoon at the spa, which was expensive, but the service was great and the atmosphere just what I needed...peaceful and relaxing. The pool was a little small, but I had no problem finding a lounge chair and the service was excellent. The Ritz-Carlton is much nicer than the Hotel Za Za where I stayed on my previous weekend get-away. The Za Za was cheap construction (you could hear everything in the rooms around you), very noisy in the halls and had rude front desk service. The Ritz-Carlton is quality contstruction, a quiet and relaxing atmosphere and impeccable service. I highly recommend it for a quiet and fun weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff & cool bar!”
Reviews.Author: caetanomi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days for business and staff were very friendly and the hotel has a very nice design. Rooms are quite standard with no extras but housekeeping and room service made an excellent job in pampering me. The room service meny is both interesting and has a good value for money. I will most remember the high level of service and i will come back for sure next time since i also checked out the W but it really didn't convince me the same way since i prefer service more than pretty faces.

Reviews.Title: “I travel constantly for work and this is my favorite hotel in the U.S.”
Reviews.Author: GabyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I travel for work, and am fortunate that I mostly end up in major U.S. cities (San Francisco, Chicago Boston, NY, etc) I am fotunate that my firm allows me to stay in good hotels. Over the last 6 months I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Dallas and it is perfect in every respect. The rooms are lovely, amenities are nice, and quite honestly- it is the best front desk staff I've ever come across! They make you feel welcome and comfortable the minute you arrive and go out of their way to be helpful! Dallas has other fine hotels (I like the Mansion on Turtle Creek), but this is the best.

Reviews.Title: “They really did care”
Reviews.Author: aussieNewYork
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days there in April and the service was excellent. Got a ride in the Bentley to the sixth floor museum and they recommended palomino's next door for italian food for kids which was excellent. Swam in empty pool in evening with changing lights and enjoyed their special snack at 6 pm in foyer. Only disappointment was we missed the Egyptian display as it closes at the museum at 5 p.m, instead of 9 p.m .

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Uptown / Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: UTAustin
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the fairly new Ritz Carlton in Dallas. The rooms are nice and the common areas and restaurants are first-rate. It is definitely one of the best hotels in Dallas. The hotel service was what you'd expect from a top end hotel. The employees were helpful, friendly, and out-going. The room was nice. I was in a junior suite with a good sitting area. (While it was spacious, I think the Stoneleigh down the street has a slightly better junior suite in terms of layout.) The bed was very comfortable. It had a goose-down mattress pad which was a bit soft for me, but I think most people would like. The bathroom was very nice. It had two sinks, a separate commode, a bathtub and a stand up shower. The water pressure was acceptable and the towels were fresh and plentiful. While at the hotel we had an excellent breakfast in the Fearings restaurant. It was pricey, but worth every penny. Some of the folks I was traveling with had dinner there and said it was also excellent. In the evening we had some drinks at the bar and it was very lively and had great service. The hotel has good valet parking and the valets were helpful with directions, etc. If you have friends or colleagues coming to uptown or downtown Dallas, this is a very safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dallas!!! 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: nancygamez
Reviews.Content: What can I say..... our first wedding night and this hotel was spectacular! Service, Food, all of it - 5 stars!! We had the bed and breakfast deal - the food was soooo delicious!!! We will be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Texas.............”
Reviews.Author: axle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton at Dallas for 3 nights arriving on December 31st for the Cotton Bowl game between Ole Miss and Texas Tech. I thought the RC was the best hotel we have stayed in for quite a while. We are regular RC guests and we have stayed at their properties in NYC, SF, NO, Laguna Beach, Amelia Island, DC, St. Thomas, Jamaica, Cancun, Atlanta, St. Louis, et al. I think the RC Dallas beats them all. The service was outstanding. I booked my room through the hotel and all my dinner reservations, a car to the ball game, my wife's spa reservations, etc. through Robert at the Concierge. He was outstanding. Dean Fearing had a restaurant at the Mansion on Turtle Creek but left to open his own place at the RC. We had dinner there on the 2nd which was outstanding. DF came out to speak to us and we enjoyed that. The room service, housekeeping and bell service was outstanding. We will go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “You do live in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas night here on our way to visit family. Decided to stop and take in the King Tut exhibit; booked a suite with the King Tut package. The reason for my review title is this-people, you chose to live in a hotel, so don't act all put out when hotel guests are on the premises. This was a nice splurge for Christmas night, but I doubt I would stay here again. The front desk staff, bellman, etc. were fine, but no one really went out of their way. The room was nice, but nothing special. When in our living room we could hear the guests in the next room. The bathroom was better than your standard hotel, but nothing to write home about. Dinner at Fearings was the highlight of the visit. The staff made us feel as if they were happy we were there. We had breakfast there the next morning and the staff was again very hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: MissBonie
Reviews.Content: Two girlfriends and I stayed in a suite the weekend of 12/20. Upon their arrival, they had help with their bags, where I had to schlep my own. While the suite was quite spacious, the furnishings were miminal and more modest that I would expect at the Ritz. We were able to get down to the spa for a manicure at a moment's notice and delighted in the company of "Joey" and "Dee". Spa services are expensive and include an 18% gratuity. The highlight of our stay was Sunday brunch at Fearing's. Again, expensive, but well worth every penny and not to be missed. When we do our weekend getaway again, we'll probably pass on the Ritz and try the Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, attentive service, truly worthwhile visit”
Reviews.Author: Mgz
Reviews.Content: As an alternative to spending days in the kitchen cooking a huge holiday dinner, we spent 2 nights over Christmas at Dallas' new Ritz Carlton. It was time well spent, one of the most satisfying lodging experiences I've ever had at a very competitive rate for such a property. Comments follow; feel free to email with questions. LOCATION On the south end of McKinney Ave, this hotel is directly adjacent to Crescent Court, and a short walk to numerous bars, cafes, shops and restaurants along McKinney Ave. The free trolley also runs in front of the hotel. I walked one night to/from Idle Rich, a great Irish bar, about an 8-10 minute walk. It's a great location. ROOM We reserved a junior suite at a special b&b rate, and were bumped up to a deluxe suite, a very welcome Christmas present. The king bed was very comfortable, part of the trend toward ultra-plush bedding at the better hotels. The bathroom was large, with a deep soak tub and separate shower. My favorite feature, which will now haunt my wife until we get it, was a TV embedded in the mirror above the sinks. Can you say "perfect bathroom?" The TVs had a Bose sound system, a nice touch. All in all, the room was clean, comfortable, well kept, and as good as we could have wanted. LOBBY Never one to pick a hotel on the lobby - I mean, how important is it, really? - I was impressed with the uncluttered elegance and spaciousness that surrounds once you go through the front door. I've been to a couple of Ritz Carltons, and they always seem to have a number of beautiful paintings and sculptures. It's elegant without being stuffy or unapproachable. DINING We had breakfast and lunch at Fearings, the relatively new restaurant by Dean Fearing, formerly the focal point of The Mansion At Turtle Creek (where we also dined, see other review).
